SPOTLIGHT More than any other generation, Gen X independents provide insight into how independence is shaping a new mindset and approach to the way we work. MBO Partners has sponsored research into the behavior of Gen X professionals, and how they are leading the movement towards independent work in America. Take a minute to sign up for our latest webinar <http://info.mbopartners.com/4Apr13WebGenX_RegistrationPage.html> and look at our report <http://www.mbopartners.com/state-of-independence/independent-workforce-index.html> on Gen X independents, and stay up-to-date on America’s changing workforce.
Gene Zaino CEO, MBO Partners Connect with Gene <http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=128510&locale=en_US&trk=tyah>
STEPPING OFF THE LADDER AND ONTO THE PLATFORM OF INDEPENDENCE If you are a mid-career professional considering making the transition from traditional employment to independent work, you are not alone. Nearly 6 million Gen X professionals have made the leap to solo work. In fact, these mid-career professionals represent 35% of the total independent workforce. Often characterized as the self-reliant generation, it is no surprise that so many make the leap to solo work.
Gen X is neither saddled with the “should do” burdens that Boomers carry in their more traditional career expectations, nor are they grasping at independence to pay the rent like many Gen Yers. This freedom, along with unique strengths and abilities, may make independence seem like the next logical step in a Gen Xer’s career path. However, the benefits of independent work are not without risks. Below are a few tips to help you leverage your strengths to make the shift from traditional employee to independent worker.
